snippet: Doctors’ groups have made pioneering lists of unnecessary exams that are commonly used but have no proven benefit for many patients.
abstract: Editorial applauds nine doctors' groups for identifying 45 tests and procedures that are commonly used but have no proven benefit for many patients and sometimes cause more harm than good; asserts that identifying needless procedures is the first step toward controlling rising health care costs; cautions patients that they must take responsibility as well and discipline themselves not to request care of little or no value.
lead_paragraph: Doctors’ groups have made pioneering lists of unnecessary exams that are commonly used but have no proven benefit for many patients.

headline.seo: Do You Really Need That Medical Test?
